message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
double percent = r.nextDouble()*100;
Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Double>> iterator = testMap.entrySet().iterator();
Map.Entry<String, Double> firstEntry = iterator.next();
Map.Entry<String, Double> secondEntry = iterator.next();

if(percent > 1.0 && percent < firstEntry.getValue()) {
    commands.get(commandWithMaxNegativeOffset).setDataCriteria(firstEntry.getKey());
} else if(percent > firstEntry.getValue() && percent < 100){
    commands.get(commandWithMaxNegativeOffset).setDataCriteria(secondEntry.getKey());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an iterator to iterate over the entries of the map. The first call to iterator.next() will give you the first entry (with the key "Previous" and the value 70.0 in your example), and the second call will give you the second entry (with the key "New" and the value 30.0 in your example). Then you can use these entries in your if/else conditions.
